data.title: Thai Vietjet, BAC launch pilot training programme in Thailand
data.description: Airline plans to hire 20 pilots from first batch of cadets

data.title: UNESCO experts to check proposed high-speed railway station site
data.description: Inspection aimed at ensuring project does not affect Ayutthaya Historical Park

data.title: Thailand celebrates UNESCO recognition for ‘Tom Yum Kung’ and Kebaya
data.description: The Ministry of Culture is hosting a celebration from Friday to Sunday to mark the inclusion of Tom Yum Kung and Kebaya on UNESCO's Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity at Quartier Avenue, EmQuartier Mall in Bangkok.

data.title: Upper Thailand to be in the grip of a cold spell from Sunday
data.description: South will get a respite from heavy rains today

data.title: A charter change muddle
data.description: A charter change muddle

data.title: EGAT and GIZ celebrate CIF’s success, expanding green cooling innovation network toward carbon neutrality
data.description: EGAT, in collaboration with the German Corporation for International Cooperation (GIZ), highlights the success of Cooling Innovation Fund (CIF) and Green Cooling Initiative (GCI) III, advancing Thailand’s air-conditioning and cooling industry toward green cooling technology.

data.title: South Korea’s President apologises, but doesn’t resign before impeachment vote
data.description: SEOUL — South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Saturday apologised to the public for the declaration of martial law this week that has set off widespread protests and thrust the country into political turmoil.

data.title: Laos and Thailand join hands to develop industrial cattle production chain
data.description: Laos and Thailand have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) on developing the industrial cattle production chain, marking a significant step towards advancing the cattle production industry in both countries.

data.title: Thailand ready for another thumping success in AFF Cup
data.description: AFF Mitsubishi Electric Cup (AMEC) defending champions Thailand will kick off their defence of the title on Sunday when Masatada Ishii’s side travel to Vietnam to take on Timor-Leste in their opening game in Group A.

data.title: Panot and Kritichanya set the pace at the 4th JAT-NB3 Elite Series.
data.description: Panot Sukanant from Bangkok and Kritchanya Kaopattanasakul from Chonburi kicked off the fourth stop of the JAT-NB3 Elite Series with impressive performances.

data.title: ONE Championship: 22 Fighters pass the scales, Ready to battle
data.description: Fans from around the world will be treated to some serious action as ONE Fight Night 26 airs live from Lumpinee Boxing Stadium (Rama Intra) in primetime in the United States. Which is the morning of 08.00 on Saturday, December 7

data.title: B7bn budget urged to stop farmers burning sugarcane
data.description: To curb PM2.5 pollution levels, the government has been urged to allocate a 7-billion-baht budget to encourage sugarcane farmers to harvest their crops while they are fresh rather than burn them.

data.title: A charter change muddle
data.description: A charter change muddle

data.title: Midweek goal fest: 35 strikes, thrilling ties
data.description: For many years there has been something special about matches between Newcastle and Liverpool that guarantees entertainment. Fans were not disappointed in the midweek clash at St James

data.title: Pheu Thai bill 'to curb coups'
data.description: The Pheu Thai Party has proposed a bill to amend the Defence Ministry Administration Act, which would reduce the military

data.title: Thais leave for Vietnam to begin Asean title defence
data.description: Champions Thailand left for Vietnam on Friday morning to kick off their title defence of the Asean Mitsubishi Electric Cup 2024.

data.title: 'No progress made' by JTC on Cambodia
data.description: The government has admitted that the establishment of a Joint Technical Committee (JTC) to negotiate with Cambodia on disputed maritime areas has not made any progress and is still in the process of being formed, according to Deputy Prime Minister Phumtham Wechayachai.

data.title: 'No special treatment' for Yingluck
data.description: The Ministry of Justice has denied that a rule allowing prisoners to be released on parole and detained in their houses was made for the benefit of any individual, especially former prime minister Yingluck Shinawatra.

data.title: Myanmar releases 4 Thai crew
data.description: The government will request the return of a confiscated Thai fishing boat following the release of four Thai crew members by Myanmar authorities yesterday, according to Defence Minister Phumtham Wechayachai.

data.title: Tourists flock to Phu Kradueng as all of Loei experiences cold weather
data.description: Sudden surge in visitors during extended weekend leads to shortage of porters

data.title: ONE Championship: Petchtanong denies ‘running away’ after hospital visit, with Nabil fight cancelled
data.description: Petchtanong Petchfergus’ kickboxing bout with Nabil Anane has been removed from Saturday’s ONE Fight Night 26 card at Lumpinee Stadium in Bangkok.

data.title: Police scour New York for killer of insurance CEO
data.description: NEW YORK - Armed with a growing file of clues, New York police on Friday were scouring surveillance videos and asking the public for help in finding the masked assailant who gunned down an executive of America’s biggest health insurer on a Manhattan sidewalk.

data.title: Korean special forces chief defied order to seize lawmakers
data.description: The head of the South Korean Army Special Forces said he defied an order from the defence minister to drag lawmakers out of the National Assembly to enforce  martial law  declared by President  Yoon Suk Yeol  earlier this week.

data.title: Three former MPs to be paroled on Sunday
data.description: Three former  Bhumjaithai  Party MPs imprisoned for ethical violations will be released on  parole  on Sunday, according to the Department of Corrections.

data.title: Return of 700-year-old bronze statue welcomed
data.description: The Ministry of Culture on Friday held a ceremony to hand over Phra Chao Tong, a 700-year-old bronze  Buddha statue  stolen from Wat Sri Ping Muang in October 1988, to  Phayao  province.

data.title: 7 officers in trouble after violent arrest
data.description: The Metropolitan Police Bureau (MPB) has vowed that justice will prevail in a physical  assault  case involving seven traffic police officers and the son of a retired policeman in Bangkok on Wednesday night.

data.title: Eternal Bloom: 260 Rose Varieties at Siam Paragon
data.description: Discover the beauty of 260 rose varieties at “Eternal Bloom: The Silk Rose Garden” from today until 15 December 2024 at Parc Paragon, Siam Paragon.

data.title: Chinese suspect arrested in Bangkok over trafficking of sedative
data.description: The arrest of the ‘mastermind’ follows a drug bust in Guangdong province, as authorities continue working on dismantling the ring linked to trafficking etomidate

data.title: Thai banks highlight headwinds in Laos as economy slows
data.description: Interest rate hike and tough business conditions are affecting Thai investment and financing in the neighbouring country, bankers say

data.title: Indonesia ready to send former death-row convict to Philippines
data.description: Indonesia and the Philippines signed an agreement on Friday on the repatriation of a Philippine woman who was sentenced to death for drug trafficking, an Indonesian government minister said.

data.title: Thailand on alert for ‘Disease X’
data.description: The Ministry of Public Health has alerted all its offices to be vigilant about an  infectious disease  outbreak in the Democratic Republic of  Congo  that has sickened hundreds of people and has killed at least 79 since late October.

data.title: Beachfront New Year feast sparkles at CASA MARE
data.description: Set against the stunning backdrop of Regent Beach, this gala evening promises a culinary journey featuring an extensive international buffet. Guests can savour everything from authentic Thai favourites at the Somtum & Yum Zap station to fresh selections at the sushi bar and Thai-style Izakaya seafood barbecue. A dedicated pasta station and an array of decadent desserts round out the gastronomic offerings.

data.title: Celebrate a sustainable and giving festive season
data.description: Novotel Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport invites you to experience a festive season filled with sustainability, local traditions, and heartfelt giving. From eco-friendly decorations and unique workshops to a taste of Thai cuisine and a commitment to giving back, the hotel has curated an exceptional celebration for guests of all ages.

data.title: Celebrate the season with Royal Porcelain’s stylish tableware
data.description: Festive feasts are more than just food—they’re moments to cherish with loved ones, where every detail counts, from delicious bites to the perfect table setting. Whether it’s bite-sized smoked salmon dill canapés or a refreshing bowl of som tam paired with your favourite wine, the festive season is all about bringing people together. And for tableware that delights the eyes as much as the taste buds, Royal Porcelain has unveiled a refreshed retail shop concept and exciting twists to its collections.

data.title: Moxy Bangkok unleashes playful art with ‘Fun Hunters’
data.description: Prepare for a bold, colourful celebration of creativity with ‘Fun Hunters of Bangkok,’ as Moxy Bangkok Ratchaprasong transforms into a dynamic art space this December. Featuring exclusive works by acclaimed street artists HAI HAI TOON, BONUS TMC, and TOON KAEWKERD, alongside emerging local talents, this event captures Bangkok’s lively spirit and artistic energy.

data.title: Guru's Weekly Buzz: Dec 6-12
data.description: Guru By Bangkok Post

data.title: Thai-m to toast 2025 at Blue Elephant
data.description: Picture yourself on New Year’s Eve, free from the chaos of last-minute grocery shopping and kitchen stress. Instead, you’re seated in a magnificent century-old colonial mansion, where crystal chandeliers cast a warm glow over polished teak floors, and the air is filled with the aromatic promise of an extraordinary meal to come. This is Blue Elephant Sathorn, where Master Chef Nooror Somany Steppe is preparing to orchestrate your final feast of 2024.

data.title: Sergei Nakariakov joins RBSO for an unmissable concert
data.description: The Royal Bangkok Symphony Orchestra Foundation, in collaboration with B.Grimm Group Ltd., will present a concert titled “Sergei Nakariakov plays Arutunian’s Trumpet Concerto” at 7:30 pm on Saturday, 14 December 2024 at the Thailand Cultural Centre. This concert will begin with Dr. Vanich Potavanich’s Symphonic poem “Rattanakosin (R.E. 146-237),” which aims to describe significant events of King Rama IX that occurred during R.E. 146-137 of the Rattanakosin period. A number of melodic motives are drawn from impactful national compositions, including King Rama IX’s Candlelight Blue, the Thai national anthem, Thai Royal Barge song, and Vijit Jitrangsan’s Rattanakosin (R.E. 1-145). Dr. Vanich Potavanich is the resident conductor of the RBSO and was awarded by the Ministry of Culture the 2024 Silpathorn Artist Awards.
